docs.snippet: We need “pink collar jobs” for everyone.

headline.print_headline: Men Need Help. Is Hillary Clinton the Answer?
headline.main: Men Need Help. Is Hillary Clinton the Answer?

docs.snippet: Fake profiles for a real Medal of Honor recipient keep popping up, possibly in connection with romance scams, and Facebook is slow to take them down.

headline.print_headline: Everybody Loves a Hero, Especially Fraudsters
headline.main: Everybody Loves a Hero, Especially Facebook Fraudsters

docs.abstract: David Segal The Haggler column assists father of Medal of Honor serviceman remove phony Facebook accounts of his son that were opened by scammers intent on stealing money from lovelorn individuals.

docs.snippet: With Trump aggravating religious tensions in America, a Muslim author focuses on training leaders to spread interfaith values.

headline.print_headline: Wanted: Leaders to Turn Interfaith Conflict Into Trust
headline.main: Wanted: Leaders to Turn Interfaith Conflict Into Trust

docs.snippet: Seven of the top 20 Facebook pages with the most engagement around “European Union” were explicitly pro-exit, according to CrowdTangle data.

headline.main: ‘Brexit’ Talk on Social Media Favored the ‘Leave’ Side

docs.abstract: Data analysis shows British voters who wanted Britain to leave European Union were far more engaged on Facebook and other social media than those who wished to remain.

docs.snippet: The average person spends more time on Facebook than any other leisure activity surveyed by the government except watching TV and movies.

headline.main: Facebook Has 50 Minutes of Your Time Each Day. It Wants More.

docs.abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column ponders implications of Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg’s announcement that users spend average of fifty minutes daily on his Facebook, Instagram and Messenger platforms.

docs.snippet: The Texas man was charged with murder in the stabbing of his girlfriend, and the image remained on the site before Facebook heeded her family’s calls to remove it.

headline.main: Police Say Man Posted Photo of Girlfriend’s Body on Facebook; It Lingered for 36 Hours

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc is to let small businesses in emerging markets sell to customers for free through their Facebook pages, the social media company said on Wednesday, marking a new effort to build up potential advertisers in its fastest-growing regions.

headline.print_headline: Facebook to Let Emerging Market Companies Sell Through Their Pages
headline.main: Facebook to Let Emerging Market Companies Sell Through Their Pages

docs.snippet: Deputies say a 17-year-old has been arrested after pictures of someone standing inside an above- ground tomb at a South Carolina church cemetery were posted on Facebook.

headline.print_headline: Deputies: Facebook Photo of Teen Inside Tomb Leads to Arrest
headline.main: Deputies: Facebook Photo of Teen Inside Tomb Leads to Arrest

docs.snippet: A Louisville judge, incensed when a prosecutor questioned his authority to scrap a jury panel because it lacked minorities, did not turn to appeals courts, legal precedent or other avenues typical for aggrieved jurists.

headline.print_headline: Judge Tests Limits of Free Speech With Facebook Jury Remarks
headline.main: Judge Tests Limits of Free Speech With Facebook Jury Remarks

docs.snippet: Don’t believe in American disunity. Lift your gazes beyond Yeats’ “weasels fighting in a hole.”

headline.main: Fail Better, America, on this 9/11 Anniversary
